content: double hat pattern by suviknits a warm and reversible double layer hat the outer hat is worked first and the stitches for the inner hat are then picked up from the cast-on round of the outer hat the inner hat is then worked in the opposite direction my patterns in ravelry https //www ravelry com/designers/suviknits my patterns in payhip https //payhip com/suviknits instagram @suviknits 1 copyright suviknits 2025 pattern information measurements one size fits an average adult head of 22 / 56 cm easy to adjust see tips at the end of this page height 8 ½ / 21 5 cm yarn approximately 284 yds / 260 m fingering weight yarn and laceweight mohair to be held together or dk-weight yarn if working with a single strand if working with two colors as the sample you need approximately 142 yds / 130 m each color the outer hat is shown in filcolana arwetta in color 950 and knitting for olive soft silk mohair in color putty the inner hat is show in knitting for olive merino and knitting for olive soft silk mohair both in color ballerina needles us 4 / 3 5 mm needles either a short circular needle for the main hat and a set of double pointed needles for the crown decreases or a long circular needle for the entire hat if using magic loop technique notions stitch markers tapestry needle for weaving in the yarn ends gauge 24 sts and 32 row in stockinette stitch with yarns held together = 4 / 10 cm washed and blocked abbreviations bor - beginning of round k - knit k2tog - knit 2 stitches together -1 st p - purl pm - place marker sm - slip marker ssk - slip two stitches one at a time as if to knit insert left needle into these stitches and knit them together through the back loops -1 st st / sts - stitch / stitches pattern instructions tip for adjusting the size if you d like to make a smaller/larger hat make sure that your cast-on number is divisible by 4 when it s time to start the crown decreases divide stitches by 4 and place markers to separate these sections work the decreases as explained in the pattern approximately half of the decreases on every 2nd round and the rest on every round 2 copyright suviknits 2025 outer hat cast on 112 sts join for working in the round and place the bor marker this hat uses regular cast-on and stitches are later picked up from this cast-on round for the inner hat you can also use provisional cast-on instead work 3 ¾ / 9 5 cm in k1 p1 ribbing work then in stockinette stitch until the hat measures 6 ¾ / 17 cm from the cast-on round place markers for crown decreases k28 pm 3 times k28 slip bor marker work decrease round * k1 k2tog knit to 3 sts before the next marker ssk k1 sm
